original_title: Central Bank of Sri Lanka promotes digital payments in Dambulla
original_body_lines: Continuing its Digital Payments Promotion Campaign of 2025, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has organized a promotional event on 1st and 2nd of August 2025 from 9.30 am to 7.00 pm at the Dambulla Dedicated Economic Centre with the participation of Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, the Governor of CBSL, and other senior officials.

CBSL launched its nationwide campaign under the theme ‘Shaping the future through digital payments’ considering the important role played by digital payments in enabling financial inclusion leading to economic development. The campaign intends to empower Sri Lankans with knowledge and experience of making digital payments which is a safer, more convenient, and efficient alternative to cash. As part of its campaign, CBSL successfully conducted two events in Hambantota and Nuwara Eliya districts earlier this year, in collaboration with financial institutions and other stakeholders.

Banks, finance companies, e-money service providers (i.e., mobile network operators) and LankaPay (Pvt.) Ltd. (LankaPay) – the operator of the national retail payment network will also attend the event. The general public will be able to obtain assistance for opening new accounts, registering for mobile payment applications, receiving information on products and services, resolving any issues faced when making digital payments and any other matter related to digital payments. The general public will also be able to purchase a range of goods and services from various micro, small, and medium-sized businesses present at the event and receive exclusive discounts when using digital payment methods.
